creator: tbaldock
title: Christmas tree chandelier
materials_required: Old cords (cell phone, Ethernet, cable, computer, phone wire, etc.)
description: This project describes how to build a Christmas tree chandelier using mason jars, old cords, and a light set, perfect for the holidays to display over a table.
steps: Loop string around the holes where screws go in the burnt-out light fixture. Do not tie the string.
Create as many string loops as possible to attach lights to the fixture.
Hang broken cords between the string loops. Loop Ethernet or long cords twice to adjust the hanging height.
Starting from the end without prongs, bunch the string lights and thread them through the holes you've made. It is recommended to have a helper as the lights may be heavy. Space out the lights.
Plug in the lights. Cut a hole in the mason jars (or baby bottles) large enough for the lights and string to go through.
Knot the strings three or four times and poke a light into the opening of each jar. Vary the lengths of the strings for a more visually appealing arrangement.
